string.text:
A pocket-sized electronic device meant to encompass the basic and most vital functions of a computer. The PDA is essential for daily information sharing. It comes pre-installed with a GPS module to provide geolocation and time information to the user.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:

A pocket-sized electronic device meant to encompass the basic and most vital functions of a computer. The PDA is essential for daily information sharing. It comes pre-installed with a GPS module to provide geolocation and time information to the user.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:

A pocket-sized electronic device meant to encompass the basic and most vital functions of a computer. The PDA is essential for daily information sharing. It comes pre-installed with a GPS module to provide geolocation and time information to the user. This version has been improved to retrieve and process the position of other modules connected to the network in a radius of 300 meters, making this PDA compelling among stalkers. This particular device comes with a pirated version of the IMI KilTrak software.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Shows Eliminated Target Locations

A pocket-sized electronic device meant to encompass the basic and most vital functions of a computer. The PDA is essential for daily information sharing. It comes pre-installed with a GPS module to provide geolocation and time information to the user. This version has been greatly improved to retrieve and process the position of other modules connected to the network, making this PDA compelling among stalkers. Unlike usual GPS modules, this one relies on a set of codes to acquire special privileges and more information on the connected network.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Shows Nearby Neutral Squads

This dated anomalous activity detector produces an alarm signal when anomalous particles enter a special chamber, allowing the device to register the presence of artefacts and measure the distance to the nearest one. The distance is indicated by the frequency of the sound the detector emits.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[pda_white] • %c[pda_white] Tier I
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Detects Common Artefacts

This last generation anomalous activity detector can be used to locate anomalous formations and has a color diode panel, which not only indicates the direction of artefacts, but also measures the distance to them. To switch to artefact search mode, open the device's front cover. Unfortunately, the device is programmed with a somewhat outdated list of detectable artefacts.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[pda_white] • %c[pda_white] Tier II
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Detects Common & Rare Artefacts

A next generation, scientific detector. Thanks to its three advanced detection chambers, the position of the artefact is displayed on a special LED screen in real-time. When closed, the device registers only the particles of anomalies and radiation.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[pda_white] • %c[pda_white] Tier III
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Detects All Artefacts

A prototype detector, with the expanded functionality of an anomalous frequency scanner. This device comes with a program that identifies any static areas of anomalous activity stored in the database, while retaining the ability to locate artefacts. The positions of both anomalous areas and artefacts are displayed on a special LED screen.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[pda_white] • %c[pda_white] Tier IV
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Detects All Artefacts Including Scientifically Unknown Artefacts

The RF (Radio frequencies) receiver is a small device with a highly-sensitive RF module used for basic communications. Quite common among soldiers despite the old technology. As the name suggests, it has the ability to interact with radio signals in a radius of 200m. The device is able to process radio waves with a frequency range between 30MHz and 300MHz.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:

The first prototype was designed in 2008 under Professor Sakharov's supervision in the mobile lab in Yantar. Since then, more copies have been made after its proven success in field study. This device is able to take and record measurements of anomalous fields. Its improved framework and high sensitivity sensors, guarantee reliable operation even in the most hostile environments.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Detects Anomaly Locations

This PDA seems badly damaged. Half the screen is broken and the GPS module doesn't work properly, though the interior is still in tact for the most part.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Junk

A standard, head-mounted flashlight. Useful for stalkers who find themselves out and about after dark, but may attract trouble if used unwisely. Useful as it frees up both hands for field operations.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:

A standard head-mounted flashlight in fully working order. Useful for stalkers who find themselves out and about after dark, but may attract trouble if used unwisely. This head lamp comes with a standard-issue 1PN93-1 Russian Military Forces night-vision device. Offers generation 2+ image intensification. Especially useful for operations at night or in low-light conditions.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Short-press 'N': %c[ui_gray_2]Off
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Long-press 'N': %c[ui_gray_2]On

A standard head-mounted flashlight in fully working order. Useful for stalkers who find themselves out and about after dark, but may attract trouble if used unwisely. This head lamp comes with an IIT generation 2+ image intensification. Intended for operation at night under natural illumination and in complete darkness with the infrared illuminator.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Short-press 'N': %c[ui_gray_2]Off
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Long-press 'N': %c[ui_gray_2]On

A standard head-mounted flashlight in fully working order. Useful for stalkers who find themselves out and about after dark, but may attract trouble if used unwisely. This head lamp has image-processing software that removes video noise and enhances image-intensifying capabilities of PN21K units, thus making it a full-fledged IIT generation 3+ night vision device.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Short-press 'N': %c[ui_gray_2]Off
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Long-press 'N': %c[ui_gray_2]On

A general purpose, hand-held flashlight. Unfortunately, since it requires a free hand, it cannot be used alongside most weapons. Thus, it can be used simultaneously only with pistols and other single-handed equipment.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:

Their outer layer is corroded and covered in dirt, which is a strong indication that these are almost dead. Still, like everything in the Zone, they may prove useful for frequent electric power recharges.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Junk

A pack of batteries. Intended for use in flashlights, PDAs, night vision goggles and other electronic devices. Remember to keep a few spares in case of an emergency.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Energy Source

A pack of fully charged, military batteries. Very valuable and in high demand, due to the relative scarcity of batteries in the Zone. Used by all factions and stalkers of all levels. Supplied to traders by corrupt military officers trying to earn some extra cash in the Zone.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Energy Source

A Geiger counter measures ionizing radiation and the emissions of alpha, beta and gamma particles. Invented in 1908, Geiger counters remain popular to this day and are used for measurements in health, physics, industry, geology and other fields.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Measures Radioactive Contamination
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] 'Controls' > 'Keybinds' > 'Inventory' > 'Geiger Counter'

Cold War era power unit about the size of a small walkie-talkie. Accepts almost any type of batteries. Utilizes every bit of energy from inserted batteries and supplies electronic devices with power in an enhanced stream through a set of micro wires. These can be connected to any piece of equipment, regardless of its complexity or age. Allows stalkers to use and handle numerous electronic devices, even if they have only one battery.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] portable energy source

An expensive moisture and shock-resistant PDA, featuring a chat client and an integrated music player.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] allows for playback of music and interaction within the stalker network

A prototype of the next generation GPS navigation devices with only a few copies being made. Although distributed exclusively among the highest military ranks, some devices have found their way into the hands of other parties as well. This improved module, featuring an improved framework and high sensitivity sensors, guarantees reliable operation even in the most hostile environments. Unlike usual GPS modules, this one relies on sets of codes that allows the module to acquire special privileges on the connected network. An automatic switching circuit inside the module, turns it off after 20 seconds of continuous scanning to save power.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
A modified radio, designed to communicate with other radios, filtering out as much interference as possible.\n

An advanced pulse-Doppler, weather radar mini-kit powered by a Meatchunk artefact. Considered a miracle in the meteorology field, it sends directional pulses of microwave radiation to collect weather data.\n
